column1: Dor Daedeloth was the land of Morgoth.
Dor Daedeloth was one of the three large regions of western Middle-earth
column2: along with Beleriand and Hithlum. It lay all around the fortress of Angband and on both sides of the Ered Engrin. Its borders were the Ered Wethrin to the west
column3: the Ered Luin to the east
column5: the Pass of Sirion and the March of Maedhros to the south.

column3: split the region in two separate parts. The southern part was Ard-galen
column4: the great grassy plain north of Beleriand
column5: later to become the desert of Anfauglith after the Dagor Bragollach had utterly burned it. The northern part was an unnamed region

column3: that the Orcs and other creatures of Morgoth lived and bred.

column1: The march of the Noldor in early First Age was halted there
column2: when FÃ«anor was mortally wounded by Balrogs. The Noldor then encircled the land (at least in the south)
the name Dor Daedeloth is translated as "Land of the Shadow of Horror". A later version of the name is Dor-Daedeloth

column1: Daidelos (replaced by Dor Daedeloth) was a name used for the region in early versions of the legendarium.
In J.R.R. Tolkiens last thoughts the name was to be changed into that of Dor-na-Daerachas
column4: 338 though this form was never used in his writings.
